name: TUIO In DAT
description: The TUIO In DAT receives and parses TUIO messages (received over network) into columns in the table. TUIO packets OSC bundles, so TUIO data can also be viewed in its more raw form in an OSC In DAT.	It currently uses the TUIO 1.1 protocol. The TUIO 2.0 protocol is not yet supported.
summary: The TUIO In DAT receives and parses TUIO messages (received over network) into columns in the table. TUIO packets OSC bundles, so TUIO data can also be viewed in its more raw form in an OSC In DAT.	It

parameters.name: Protocol
parameters.label: Protocol
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The TUIO In  receives and parses TUIO messages (received over network) into columns in the table. TUIO packets OSC bundles, so TUIO data can also be viewed in its more raw form in an OSC In DAT.	It currently uses the TUIO 1.1 protocol. The TUIO 2.0 protocol is not yet supported.
tuioinDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  protocol -  - Select which protocol to use, refer to the Network Protocols article for more information.

 msging - multicastmsging - reliablemsging -
		
  address - For multi-cast protocol, this is the multi-cast address to listen for.


		
  port - The port which TUIO In will accept packets on.


		
  shared - Use the same connection as other networking DATs using the same network protocol.


		
  active - While on, the  receives information sent to the network port. While Off, no updating occurs. Data sent to the port is lost.





  callbacks - The Callbacks  will get callbacks for TUIO events. See tuioinDAT_Class for usage.


		
  executeloc -  - Determines the location the script is run from.

 current - The script is executed from the current node location (for example, where 'cc' points to). callbacks - The script is executed from the location of the  specified in the Callbacks  parameter. op - The script is executed from the operator specified in the From Operator parameter below.
		
  fromop - The operator whose state change will trigger the  to execute its script when Execute from is set to Specified . This operator is also the path that the script will be executed from if the Execute from parameter is set to Specified .





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. language - pick extension from DATs script language. custom - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



Extra Information for the TUIO In  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.


 -
 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditor2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



Any of the procedural data operators. OPs do all the work in TouchDesigner. They "cook" and output data to other OPs, which ultimately result in new images, data and audio being generated. See Node.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=TUIO_In_DAT&oldid=31218"
		Category: DATs
